text: Hello, how are you all? Welcome to Chai Aur Code and our unique YouTube channel where I am teaching you how to develop a full stack through Django Two important things One, we messed up a little in the sequence of series upload which is now fixed, playlist is arranged well and you are getting articles It happens sometimes Actually, what happened is the name of the same video was copied twice so I got confused All responsibility on me I messed it up, no team did it but now it is fixed Second important thing Our platform is now available on chaicode.com You will get all the articles, videos and code files and the platform is now available so the paid codes will also be available so it is almost ready So, what will we see in this video We have seen the basics of Django like templates, routes URLs, when to call them One more major aspect of Django is the models How it interacts with database How the database configuration is in Django We will see all of them from here We will see in this way that you will get 100% confidence that yes, I can also write models If you want to learn more about models then you can learn but I think the best way to learn Django models is through projects because how long you will go in documentation it is not possible So, as and when there is a requirement you can go and learn and if you make a few projects with someone it becomes very good In this model, we will see image upload how Django handles images I think one of the best way that Django handles images is that it keeps images in folders and saves the URL and not just puts the whole image in the DB It is also possible but it is not optimized Let's see Our comment target is 200 comments Not much, just 200 comments Do a little bit You are free now Push the series Let's share the screen and discuss it By the way, I will publish the entire article I have already written the article as a reference guide You will get it You are liking the article a lot Thank you so much for this So, where are we now? This is our VS Code I have activated our virtual environment and where are we now? Let me open it in a browser So, I have opened the browser and you know how to run the command It is very basic It is a simple Python manage.py run server This is our case where we run the server We have not seen much but we have the knowledge that we can keep the templates like this We can keep the templates inside the project like the tea project You can keep the template here We have all tea If you want to see the URL We have learned how to manage the URL We can go directly to the tea How will we know this? We will know it from the main project There are the URLs We are forwarding the redirection or the control of the URL after the tea to the tea.url We got to know about the tea because we have mentioned the tea in the settings.py So, the tea keyword came here and we said that there is a .url So, you can take the URL file So, we got to know it like this Now, we come here We have not worked on the UI We have told you how to use Tailwind I will try to do something more on Tailwind Components are just drag and drop We will see that later Now, we will come back to what else we have to do We have not done anything special yet I will tell you one more thing Now, you can go to the admin But, what happens is that you forget the login id and password Especially, if you are doing the development then it is a very obvious case For this, there is a Python script You can reset it I know that many of you must have got this problem So, we will go to Google And we will call it Reset Django admin password So, run manage.py You will get an option Python manage.py You can change the password of the user or the main db user I think the user was Hitesh Let's try this once Change password Let's run this with the user Let's kill it Python manage.py Change password I think Hitesh was the user's admin Change password Hitesh Password is too similar 8 characters Hitesh 123 Hitesh 123 Password is too similar and it is not giving the option to change it Chai1234 Chai1234 Chai1234 Now, I am happy that Chai1234 is the password Let's run this again and see if we can login to the admin Hitesh Password is Chai1234 Yes At least I am able to go to the admin and we can see that we have only one user Now, what we will do We want to use this admin but we don't have any Chai models So, for the first time, we will interact with the database to see how the database can help us Whenever you want to interact with the database the first step is Whenever you want to make anything data related you don't make it in the main project in the production If you don't make it in the production then why will you make it in the tutorial Here, you don't see the models.py file and it doesn't exist No one creates it The first app we created Remember, project and app are different Project is the whole project App is the small apps You can also call it micro services architecture It is not exactly, but you can call it No one will shout at you that why did you say We go to Chai, which is the new app Here, you have seen by default that you have models.py and admin.py file How are these files routed How are they associated with each other Let's discuss that First of all, for the database You can write models directly Why are you able to write directly? Why is it important to know? That's why you like tutorials Because everything has a detailed discussion It is fun to see Where is it coming from We know the framework like this We have seen it in front of our eyes First thing you see here is db.escolite This is an important file Because we have the whole sequel in it If you go to Chai and Django If you go to settings.py You will see many options here How do you handle the database The database we have is like this Our engine is Django.db.backends.escolite But these engines can be changed In fact, you have a complete URL of how to reset the database You can go and study it It is the best thing that we have been given the same We have escolite 3 But we have access to Postgres You have access to MySQL And MongoDB is also there But it takes a little extra configuration I have seen Django with SQL databases You get the option from here Now we know that we are using SQLite database But we can change the configuration here And put it in Postgres No need to change the code You do not interact directly with the database There is an ORM layer in between We interact with the database through the layer So in one setting you can go from SQLite to Postgres From Postgres to MySQL Now we reach Our main topic We have a lot of questions Now we reach Models.py How to write models in Django You can see that models are imported On the first line We will do all the work through this It is very easy to write models Suppose I write a simple class My model will be ChaiVariety I write the name of the class ChaiVariety My model is ChaiVariety I am making a table How to make this table You can take a dot from the top And take a model How to write a class It is very easy I can write all the fields I can write a name field You can write a name field How to write All are copy pasted We come to models As I have access to it As soon as you put a dot, you will get all the fields There is documentation You can take big integer, average, auto There are many Emails, enums I will tell you something You will get fast learning There are many fields Field depends on the suggestion Which database is active Like in Postgres There are some additional fields You will not get in the suggestion In case you use it, it will give an error Because in configuration, in settings, there is SQLite You are using the field of Postgres The most common field Char field, char field Character field You can pass some default options To know the options Or we will make some projects Then you will know the maximum There is documentation Max length, I need 100 characters In my name After that Image How to handle image For now, let's design the field Then I will tell you how to set For images But images are not supported You have to bring a third party plugin Which is pillow And then you have to do some additional settings To put my images in this folder For now, let's write We only need image field So we give it dot image field And after this image field You will also have to tell Where to upload Suppose I want to upload Now as soon as you save it You will see an error I open it It has said Get pillow at To run the command Python-mpip install pillow So we need pillow Let's go for now So images are handled When you upload your jango images It will put it in this folder You have to set the folder And save that url in the database And save that url in the database Not images Apart from this, suppose I have a field I have to take a date field I have to add date added here To add date, you have to take Timezone libraries But for that too we have jango available In jango, a class called utils Is available Through which you can import a lot of things Like here you see A lot of things are available Our use is simple timezone Let's take timezone Now what is the
